subject: Politics
title: The Deep State Debate
description: One-minute skill: The Deep State Debate.

hook.text: Is a 'deep state' secretly running the government? The truth is less dramatic but still worth understanding.

buildup.text: The deep state concept refers to unelected bureaucrats, military, and intelligence officials who hold lasting influence.

discovery.text: In Turkey and Egypt, the military has historically overruled elected leaders. Institutional power runs deep.

twist.text: In stable democracies, career officials provide expertise and continuity. Calling that a 'deep state' distorts reality.

climax.text: The real question isn't conspiracy. It's how much power unelected officials should have in a democracy.

punchline.text: Unelected power is real. It's not a conspiracy â€” it's a design feature.

quiz.question: What does the 'deep state' concept typically refer to?
options: Unelected bureaucrats, military, and intelligence officials with lasting influence
A secret shadow government that controls all world events
The official cabinet members of a democratic government
